fields.headline: Spotlight on North Korea
fields.bodyText: Tensions between North Korea and the international community have mounted in recent months. The country has claimed to have nuclear weapons, the US and Japan have blocked its oil supplies and its people are in the grip of a humanitarian crisis as food aid dries up. Each day this week, Guardian Unlimited looks at the problems facing North Korea. On Monday, Simon Tisdall introduces our series with his profile of a secretive, famine-ravaged country demonised as part of George Bush's 'axis of evil'. Read this article On Tuesday, John Gittings reports from Shanghai on how China is dealing with US 'interference' in its sphere of influence. Read this article On Wednesday, Rick Corsino, head of the World Food Programme in North Korea, looks at the humanitarian crisis in North Korea. On Thursday we present a weblog special: the best writing on North Korea from elsewhere on the internet. On Friday, Jonathan Watts looks at the view from Pyongyang. How does North Korea view its place in the world? You'll also find photos of the "forgotten" Korean war and images of contemporary life in one of the last bastions of communism, and an interactive guide to the history of North Korea.
